entity.description: DBus interface design requirements based on existing codebase: 1) Use org.dots namespace prefix 2) Session bus for user-level services 3) zbus 4.0+ with async/await patterns 4) Comprehensive error handling with custom error types 5) All methods return Result<T, Error> 6) Use serde for complex data serialization 7) Interface traits defined in dots-family-proto crate 8) Implementation in *-dbus_impl.rs files 9) Mock implementations for testing 10) Service activation via DBus service files in dbus/ directory

requirements.description: Use org.dots.* namespace with PascalCase service names: org.dots.FamilyDaemon, org.dots.FamilyMonitor
requirements.title: Interface Naming Convention

requirements.description: Use session bus for all family control operations to maintain per-user isolation and security
requirements.title: Session Bus Usage

requirements.description: All DBus methods must return proper error types, implement timeout handling for DBus calls, use consistent error mapping between zbus errors and application errors, and provide detailed error context for debugging
requirements.title: Error Handling Standards

requirements.description: All DBus interfaces must have comprehensive XML introspection data, method signatures documented with parameter types and descriptions, signal documentation with emission conditions, and usage examples in rustdoc
requirements.title: Interface Documentation

entity.title: DBus Interface Design Standards
